*div1 type="summary"* *p*[S. T.] Angier to Austin, June 3, 1827. Application for land.*/p* */div1*
*div1 type="body"*
*p**date_mentioned n="06-03-1827">June 3d 1827*/date_mentioned*.*/p*
*p*Sir, I have visited the lands on *location_mentioned*Chocolate Bayou*/location_mentioned* at The request of *person_mentioned*Mr J. B. Hall*/person_mentioned*; and Think a league can be obtained, having Timber suitable for lumber; and a water privilige That may be used four months in The year. I feel willing To choose the land for him, if The lines can be run To his liking otherwise it will be of little account; for The *location_mentioned*timbered land*/location_mentioned* is very narrow.*/p*
*p*Lest I may not be able To see you soon, (for I have been waiting *person_mentioned*Mr Hall*/person_mentioned*'s return) that I may know my own chance for obtaining land, before you leave us for The *location_mentioned*interior*/location_mentioned*; I wish To know whether, in case you have not made me a selection, I may not have *location_mentioned*land That is forfeited*/location_mentioned* and lying without the *location_mentioned*Ten leagues reserved*/location_mentioned*. For I understand That The land granted to *person_mentioned*Joseph Calvert*/person_mentioned* is To be forfeited, if so, I would like To procure it, should it meet your approbation*/p*.
*p*[Endorsed:]*person_mentioned* Angier*/person_mentioned* *date_mentioned n="06-03-1827">June 3d 1827*/date_mentioned**/p*
*/div1*
